On 9/15/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Mark,
>
> Would a supported version of JUnit 3.8 meet your needs? Or are there
> particular features of JUnit 4 or TestNG that you're looking for?


Sorry David, I haven't been clear enough. I don't want an upgraded 3.8.1 -
that appears to Martin. I'm looking to switch to JUnit 4 but get it running
under Java 1.4. In particular I need the @BeforeClass and @AfterClass
attributes to minimize file I/O in a few cases. In general I also prefer the
declarative approach of JUnit 4 to the inheritance based approach of 3.8.1.

Thanks in advance.
Mark
